ui.viralSub: Scan QR code to start the test

guide.purpose: This assessment analyzes where you place the control of your life based on 'Locus of Control' theory. It measures the mindset of successful people.
guide.instruction: Read each statement and select the option that best matches your usual thoughts. The more honest you are, the more accurate your profile will be.
guide.interpretation: Results show Internal vs External control tendencies. Higher internal control indicates self-directedness and is associated with greater success probability.

items.text: Most of what happens in my life depends on my own efforts.
I think success in life is largely determined by luck.
I have enough ability to change situations to get what I want.
The world is so complex that what I do doesn't make much difference.
When a problem arises, I feel responsible for solving it.
Sometimes I feel that outcomes are already predetermined no matter how hard I try.
I believe I can design and create my own future.
Bad things that happen to me are usually due to bad luck beyond my control.
If you work hard enough, anyone can achieve their goals.
Looking at successful people, it seems they had good opportunities rather than pure skill.

L.high: You have a strong 'internal locus of control.' You pioneer your own life and believe you can change outcomes through effortâ€”a proactive type with key elements of a success mindset.
L.low: You have a strong 'external locus of control.' You respect environmental flows and luck, sometimes finding peace by adapting to situations. You value natural flow.
